channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023070049
item.description:
Report E-2023070049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the final inspection of the waste before loading it for outbound transportation to the disposal facility, a 55 gallon metal open top drum was found to have a pinhole leak in the sidewall that was not apparent on Friday during the facility inspection. The drum was promptly overpacked. Approximately ~100 ml of liquid was cleaned up from the pallet it leaked onto.

item.title: Report E-2023060801
item.description:
Report E-2023060801

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of purple primer (un1993) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 3 quarts of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023060717
item.description:
Report E-2023060717

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the quality control process in the warehouse at Veolia's ten day intrasit facility in Port Allen, LA, the drum was inadvertently knocked over onto it's side by the forklift operator and began to slowly leak from the bottom of the drum. An inspection of the drum revealed a puncture near the chime of the drum, as well as two spots towards the bottom, center of the drum where the paint was flaked and appeared to be an additional source of a leak as well. The drum was promptly overpacked for continued transportation and the spill was cleaned up.
